latest news.eng_title: Borderlands 4 release date estimate, trailers, and latest news
latest news.summary: Borderlands 4 is a new game in the series, announced after the release of the Borderlands movie. The game's release date is estimated to be in September or October 2025, based on previous release dates in the series. The game will be released on PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X|S. A one-minute cinematic reveal trailer was shown at Gamescom Opening Night Live in August 2024, featuring the planet Pandora and a hint at the story, which takes off where Borderlands 3 finished. The trailer suggests that the story may involve Handsome Jack, who was thought to be finished in the series. The game's story will likely explore Pandora and the Great Vault, where the team found the Vault in Borderlands 3. Further details on the game are expected to be released before the Borderlands 4 release date.
latest news.title: Borderlands 4 release date estimate, trailers, and latest news

latest news.eng_title: Zed Code Editor Begins Adding AI Features Powered By Anthropic's Claude
latest news.summary: Zed, a code/text editor developed by former Atom editor developers, is integrating AI-powered functionality using Anthropic's Claude LLM. Zed AI, announced on Tuesday, is a hosted service for AI-enabled coding within the Zed editor, leveraging the Anthropic Claude 3.5 Sonnet large language model. The feature is currently free during its initial launch period and requires a sign-on, but will likely become a paid feature. Zed AI is similar to GitHub Copilot, providing code auto-completion across various programming languages. For more information, interested developers can visit the Zed.dev blog.
latest news.title: Zed Code Editor Begins Adding AI Features Powered By Anthropic's Claude

latest news.summary: Gearbox Studio's president Randy Pitchford wasn't joking when he recently announced at Gamescom Live that Borderlands 4 will be released in 2025 on multiple platforms. Although no Nintendo release was mentioned, there is a good chance for a future release, as a 'successor' to the Switch is planned to be announced this fiscal year. The teaser trailer for Borderlands 4 doesn't reveal much, but according to the description, players will once again take on the role of a Vault Hunter while searching for a 'secret space treasure' on a new planet, while blowing everything up in sight. This announcement comes after the release of Borderlands 3 Ultimate Edition on Nintendo Switch in October last year.
latest news.title: تم الإعلان رسميًا عن Borderlands 4، إليكم المقطع الدعائي

latest news.eng_title: Gamescom Opening Night Live 2024: Highlights and Release Dates

Product: Indiana Jones e il grande cerchio

latest news.summary: The Gamescom Opening Night Live 2024 has started, and it's been a great show. Over 40 game trailers were shown, including new games like 'Nikoderiko: The Magical World', which is similar to 'Crash Bandicoot' or 'Donkey Kong'. The event started with a 30-minute pre-show, where new information was revealed about the Soulslike game 'Enotria: The Last Song'. The main show featured a fireworks display of new trailers, including 'Civilization VII', 'Mafia: The Old Country', 'Indiana Jones e il grande cerchio', 'Borderlands 4', 'Kingdom Come Deliverance 2', 'Batman: Arkham Shadow', 'Herdling', 'Starfield: Shattered Space', 'Monument Valley 3', 'Lost Records: Bloom &; Ramp', and 'Call of Duty: Black Ops 6'. 'Civilization VII' allows players to mix and match epochs and leaders, while 'Mafia: The Old Country' is set in the early 20th century and explores the beginnings of organized crime in Sicily. 'Indiana Jones e il grande cerchio' has a release date of December 9, 2024, and will be available on Xbox Series X/S, PC, and PlayStation 5. 'Borderlands 4' is set to release sometime in 2025, while 'Kingdom Come Deliverance 2' will be released on February 11, 2025. 'Batman: Arkham Shadow' will be released on Meta Quest 3 in October 2024, and 'Herdling' is a farming simulation game set to release in 2025. 'Starfield: Shattered Space' will be released on September 30, 2024, and 'Monument Valley 3' will be released on Netflix on December 10, 2024. 'Lost Records: Bloom &; Ramp' will be released on February 18, 2025, and 'Call of Duty: Black Ops 6' will be released on October 25, 2024.
latest news.title: I momenti salienti del Gamescom Opening Night Live 2024

Product: Indiana Jones and the Circle of the Ancients

latest news.summary: The gamescom 2024 conference revealed several new games, including Borderlands 4, which will be released in 2025 on PC, Xbox Series, and Playstation 5. The game's developer, Gearbox, has not revealed much about the game, except that it will feature some familiar characters from the franchise. Another game, Reanimal, was also announced, which will be released in 2025 on Xbox Series, Playstation 5, and PC. The game is a horror adventure that follows a brother and sister as they try to save their friends on a cursed island. Civilization 7 was also shown, with its release date set for February 11, 2025, on PC, Xbox Series, Playstation 5, and Nintendo Switch. Additionally, a new Batman game, Batman: Arkham Shadow, was announced, which will be released in October 2024 on the Meta Quest 3. The game is a virtual reality experience that follows Batman as he faces off against his greatest enemies. Other games announced include Indiana Jones and the Circle of the Ancients, which will be released on PC, Xbox Series, and Playstation 5 in December 2024, and Mafia: The Old Country, which will be released on Xbox Series, Playstation 5, and PC, but no release date has been set. 'It's a great time for gamers,' said the conference organizer, 'with so many exciting new games being announced.'
latest news.title: Borderlands 4, Civilization 7, Batman... Les jeux à retenir de la conférence d'ouverture de la gamescom 2024

latest news.eng_title: Writers' lawsuit against Anthropic highlights tensions between AI developers & artists
latest news.summary: A proposed class action lawsuit has been filed against Anthropic, an AI developer backed by Amazon, alleging that the company has illegally used pirated and copyrighted materials to train its Claude chatbot. The lawsuit, filed by authors Andrea Bartz, Charles Graeber, and Kirk Wallace Johnson, claims that Anthropic has deprived authors of revenue by enabling the creation of AI-generated lookalikes of their books. 'Claude in particular has been used to generate cheap book content... [and it] could not generate this kind of long-form content if it were not trained on a large quantity of books, books for which Anthropic paid authors nothing,' the complaint states. This is the first time that Anthropic has been sued by writers, and it raises key questions about the company's ethics and governance practices. Anthropic has positioned itself as an ethical counterbalance to OpenAI, but the lawsuit may test its commitment to responsible AI development.
latest news.title: Writers' lawsuit against Anthropic highlights tensions between AI developers & artists

latest news.eng_title: Claude AI chatbot creator Anthropic sued by authors for copyright infringement
latest news.summary: A group of authors is suing Anthropic, the creator of the popular chatbot Claude, for 'large-scale theft' in training the chatbot on pirated copies of copyrighted books. The lawsuit alleges that Anthropic's actions 'have made a mockery of its lofty goals' by tapping into repositories of pirated writings to build its AI product, contradicting its marketing as a responsible and safety-focused developer of generative AI models. This is the first lawsuit from writers to target Anthropic and its Claude chatbot, following similar lawsuits against competitor OpenAI, maker of ChatGPT. 'The Interface' podcast notes that business leaders and scientists share insights that shape tomorrow's innovation, available on YouTube, Apple Podcasts and Spotify.
latest news.title: Claude AI chatbot creator Anthropic sued by authors for copyright infringement

latest news.eng_title: Anthropic asks court to ‘prune' Universal lawsuit to focus court battle on ‘whether it is fair use' to train AI using copyrighted works
latest news.summary: Anthropic, the developer of the AI chatbot Claude, has asked a US federal court to dismiss three of the four counts brought against it by music publishers including Universal Music Publishing Group. The lawsuit alleges that Claude 'unlawfully copies and disseminates vast amounts of copyrighted works.' Anthropic argues that the music publishers' evidence is 'facially deficient' and that the court should focus on the question of whether it is fair use to train AI models using copyrighted works. The company plans to argue that its use of copyrighted materials falls under the 'fair use' exemption to US copyright laws. 'For Claude… the training process makes copies of information for the purposes of performing a statistical analysis of the data,' Anthropic stated in a submission to the US Copyright Office last year. 'The copying is merely an intermediate step, extracting unprotectable elements about the entire corpus of works, in order to create new outputs.' Matt Oppenheim, a lawyer for the music publishers, described the motion to dismiss as 'completely without merit' and an attempt by Anthropic to 'avoid taking responsibility for its massive infringement of copyrights.'
latest news.title: Anthropic asks court to ‘prune' Universal lawsuit to focus court battle on ‘whether it is fair use' to train AI using copyrighted works

latest news.eng_title: The Best AI Tools for 2024: A Guide to Unlocking the Power of AI
latest news.summary: The article highlights the best AI tools for 2024, covering various needs such as text generation, image creation, music composition, and more. Some of the tools mentioned include ChatGPT for text generation, Leonardo AI for image creation, Gamma for presentations, Suno for music creation, ChatMind for organizing ideas, Microsoft Designer for social media graphics, Recraft AI for logo design, CapCut for video editing, Gemini for travel planning, ElevenLabs for voice cloning, and Notta AI for audio transcription. The article notes that while these tools are powerful, they may not be perfect and can sometimes generate generic responses. However, they are still valuable options for professionals who need to produce high-quality content quickly.
latest news.title: Las mejores herramientas de inteligencia artificial para 2024: una guía para aprovechar al máximo la IA

latest news.eng_title: Dragon Ball Sparking Zero: A Nostalgic Return to the Android Saga
latest news.summary: Bandai Namco has released new images and a trailer for Dragon Ball Sparking Zero, a game that aims to bring back nostalgia for the Android Saga. The trailer shows iconic characters from the series, including Trunks from the Future and Cell, in epic battles. The game's graphics, powered by Unreal Engine 5, are impressive and showcase the game's potential. According to Bandai Namco, the game will be released on October 11, 2024, for PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X|S. As stated by the company, 'the game is an opus that aims to carve out a special place in the hearts and minds of fans of the manga and anime series created by the late Akira Toriyama.'
latest news.title: Dragon Ball Sparking Zero: è il momento della nostalgia androide

news knowledge.eng_title: Anthropic's Latest Claude AI Model Is Available. This Is What It Gives You
news knowledge.summary: Anthropic has released Claude 3.5 Sonnet, a new language model for its chatbot family, which is said to be funnier, a better writer, and more adept at software engineering. The model is available for free on iOS and Android, and will be followed by two additional models later this year. Claude 3.5 Sonnet outperforms the previous model, Claude 3 Opus, and is ideal for complex tasks such as context-sensitive customer support and multistep workflows. The model also has strong levels of comprehension and fluency in multiple languages, including German, Italian, Dutch, and Russian. Additionally, it can interpret charts and graphs, and is twice as fast as Claude 3 Opus. Anthropic is also working on additional features for business users, such as web search and memory, which will allow Claude to remember user preferences and interaction history.
news knowledge.title: Anthropic's Latest Claude AI Model Is Available. This Is What It Gives You

news knowledge.eng_title: Organizing Projects with Artificial Intelligence: Claude 3.5 Sonnet Now Available
news knowledge.summary: Anthropics has released a new version of its AI assistant, Claude 3.5 Sonnet, which is positioned between the smaller and more affordable Claude 3 Haiku and the larger, more intelligent, and more expensive Claude 3 Opus. According to the provider, the new version 3.5 Sonnet surpasses the older, larger model, and also features useful new functions.
news knowledge.title: So organisieren Sie Projekte mit künstlicher Intelligenz

news knowledge.eng_title: New AI Model Claude 3.5 Challenges OpenAI's GPT-4o
news knowledge.summary: Claude 3.5, a new AI model, has been released, challenging OpenAI's GPT-4o as the standard for quality, efficiency, and ambition in the industry. According to a recent article by Freedidi, Claude 3.5 Sonnet marks the arrival of the first product in the Claude 3.5 series, surpassing the competition and Claude 3 Opus in evaluations. The model excels in postgraduate-level reasoning, undergraduate-level skills, and coding-related abilities, and has made significant progress in understanding nuances, interpreting humor, and following complex instructions. It also performs twice as fast as Claude 3 Opus and has become the most powerful visual model to date, ideal for tasks that require visual reasoning or transcribing text from imperfect images. The question remains whether OpenAI can finally have real competition with these advancements.
news knowledge.title: A OpenAI y ChatGPT le salen competencia con una IA gratis que crea hasta páginas web

news knowledge.eng_title: Claude 3.5 Sonnet: Anthropic's New Large Language Model Surpasses Competitors' Results
news knowledge.summary: Anthropic, a San Francisco-based startup, has released its new Large Language Model (LLM) called Claude 3.5 Sonnet, which has surpassed the results of competitors' models and its own high-end model, Claude 3 Opus, in internal tests. According to the company, Claude 3.5 Sonnet has outperformed GPT-4, Gemini 1.5 Pro, and Meta's Llama 3 400B in seven comprehensive benchmarks and four visual benchmarks. The model shows significant improvements in writing and translating code, managing multi-phase workflows, interpreting diagrams and graphs, and transcribing text from images. Additionally, Claude 3.5 Sonnet is able to grasp nuances, humor, and complex instructions, and is agile in writing high-quality content with a natural and relatable tone.
news knowledge.title: Come funziona Claude 3.5 Sonnet e cosa sa fare: i test superati #DatavizAndTools

news knowledge.eng_title: Anthropic's Claude: What To Know About ChatGPT Rival After Latest Model Trounces Industry Giants
news knowledge.summary: Anthropic, a US-based AI company, has released its latest generative AI model, Claude 3.5 Sonnet, which is already outperforming its competitors, including OpenAI's GPT-4o, on key AI benchmarks. The model is part of Anthropic's Claude family of AI models, which includes Haiku and Opus, and is designed for efficient, high-throughput tasks. Claude 3.5 Sonnet has climbed to the top of the LMSYS Chatbot Arena, a major crowdsourced benchmarking site, and has outperformed its older sibling, Claude Opus 3. Anthropic aims to release Claude 3.5 Haiku and Claude 3.5 Opus later this year, with the goal of improving the tradeoff curve between intelligence, speed, and cost every few months.
news knowledge.title: Anthropic's Claude: What To Know About ChatGPT Rival After Latest Model Trounces Industry Giants

news knowledge.eng_title: Claude 3.5 Sonnet: The Best AI Model Right Now, But No One's Talking About It
news knowledge.summary: Anthropic has released its latest AI model, Claude 3.5 Sonnet, which claims to surpass GPT-4o of OpenAI and Gemini of Google in various tasks. The main issue is that the developer lacks the commercial and communication strength of others, which may lead to the model being relegated to an alternative rather than a protagonist in the current AI scenario. The new model is already available for users on the Web and iOS, and Anthropic is also making it available to developers. Claude 3.5 Sonnet is the intermediate model in the range, with Haiku for the smallest model, Sonnet for the mainstream option, and Opus for the high-end model. The novelty of Artifacts is that it allows users to see and interact with the results of their requests in real-time. For example, if you ask the model to design something, it can show you how the design appears and allow you to modify it directly from the app. This is a small feature, but it's intelligent: these AI tools must become more than just chatbots, and Artifacts is on the right track towards achieving this goal.
news knowledge.title: Claude 3.5 Sonnet è il miglior modello di AI al momento ma nessuno ne parla

news knowledge.eng_title: Anthropic Unveils Claude 3.5 Sonnet, a Powerful AI Model to Challenge ChatGPT
news knowledge.summary: Anthropic has announced Claude 3.5 Sonnet, a powerful AI model that aims to compete with OpenAI's ChatGPT. Claude 3.5 Sonnet features visual thinking, humor, complex instructions, and programming capabilities. Future versions, including Claude 3.5 Haiku and Claude 3.5 Opus, will include features for enterprise integration. This could potentially threaten OpenAI's position as the market leader in consumer AI chatbots. The company, founded by former OpenAI research leaders, has received support from companies like Google, Salesforce, and Amazon. 'Claude 3.5 Sonnet sets the bar for intelligence in the industry higher and surpasses competitor models,' said the developers in a blog post. The model has 'set new standards in the industry' for logical thinking on a university level, knowledge on a primary school level, and programming capabilities. 'These incremental improvements are particularly noticeable in tasks that require visual thinking, such as interpreting tables and graphics.' Claude 3.5 Sonnet can also transcribe text from imperfect images with high accuracy, a crucial ability for e-commerce, logistics, and financial services. As part of the update, the team announced 'Artifacts,' which allow users to give Claude a command that opens in a separate window. 'The result is a dynamic workspace where users can see, edit, and develop Claude's creations in real-time…'. The developers also announced that they will release Claude 3.5 Haiku and Claude 3.5 Opus later this year. The company aims to develop features to support businesses, including integration with enterprise applications. 'Our team is also working on features like Memory, which allows Claude to store user preferences and interaction history to make the experience more personalized and efficient.'
news knowledge.title: Claude 3.5: ChatGPT-Konkurrent bringt seine bisher beste KI auf den Markt

news knowledge.eng_title: Anthropic's Claude 3.5 Sonnet surges to top of AI rankings, challenging industry giants
news knowledge.summary: Anthropic's new AI model, Claude 3.5 Sonnet, has surpassed expectations by securing the top position in key categories of the LMSYS Chatbot Arena, a prominent benchmark for large language model performance, just five days after its public release. The model has outperformed its predecessor, Claude 3 Opus, and achieved parity with frontier models such as GPT-4o and Gemini 1.5 Pro across various benchmarks. Claude 3.5 Sonnet's impressive showing in the 'Hard Prompts' category is particularly noteworthy, as it was designed to challenge AI models with complex, specific, and problem-solving oriented tasks. The implications of Claude 3.5 Sonnet's performance extend beyond mere rankings, as it has the potential to disrupt the AI industry, especially for enterprise customers seeking advanced AI capabilities for complex tasks.
news knowledge.title: Anthropic's Claude 3.5 Sonnet surges to top of AI rankings, challenging industry giants

news knowledge.eng_title: Anthropic's Claude 3.5 Sonnet Challenges GPT-4o with Improved Performance
news knowledge.summary: Anthropic has released Claude 3.5 Sonnet, a new AI language model that surpasses OpenAI's GPT-4o in several benchmark tests. Claude 3.5 Sonnet is part of the Claude 3 model family, which also includes Claude 3 Opus and Claude 3 Haiku. It is designed to be a balanced combination of intelligence and speed, with impressive abilities in complex tasks such as high-level argumentation, bachelor-level knowledge, and advanced programming skills. According to Anthropic, Claude 3.5 Sonnet works twice as fast as its predecessor Claude 3 Opus and has improved vision capabilities, allowing it to dynamically and collaboratively interact with users. The model is positioned as the middle model in the Anthropic product line, with Haiku being the smallest and Opus being the most advanced. Claude 3.5 Sonnet is expected to surpass Claude 3 Opus in many areas, including argumentation at a graduate level, knowledge at a university level, and programming skills. The model is also expected to demonstrate superior performance in visual understanding, surpassing GPT-4o in tasks such as understanding mathematical diagrams, scientific illustrations, and documents.
news knowledge.title: Claude 3.5 Sonnet: Anthropic's neue KI fordert GPT-4o heraus

news knowledge.eng_title: New Claude 3.5 Sonnet AI beats ChatGPT-4o
news knowledge.summary: Anthropic has released Claude 3.5 Sonnet, a new AI model that surpasses the performance of GPT-4. The model features advanced context handling, processing 200,000 tokens of context, and faster generation speeds. It also includes state-of-the-art vision recognition technology and an 'artifacts' feature for interactive code generation. The model is designed to be user-friendly and accessible, prioritizing practical use cases over benchmark scores. According to an internal evaluation, Claude 3.5 Sonnet solved 64% of problems, outperforming its predecessor Claude 3 Opus. The model's capabilities make it a valuable tool for a wide range of applications, from content creation to research and analysis.
news knowledge.title: New Claude 3.5 Sonnet AI beats ChatGPT-4o
